name: Qal'at al-Bahrain
description: Ancient harbor and capital of Dilmun, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Bab Al Bahrain
description: Historical building located in the Customs Square in Manama.

name: Tree of Life
description: A 400-year-old tree standing alone in the desert.

name: Al Fateh Grand Mosque
description: One of the largest mosques in the world, encompassing 6,500 square meters.

name: Bahrain National Museum
description: The largest and one of the oldest public museums in Bahrain.

name: The Lost Paradise of Dilmun Water Park
description:
The Lost Paradise, Bahrain is a Dilmun Era- Themed Waterpark and the first ever outdoor waterpark in the Kingdom of Bahrain. It was built on the 2nd of September, 2007. Set as the biggest and currently covers an overall area of 77,000 sq. meters,

The Lost Paradise of Dilmun has recaptured the ancient history of Bahrain by integrating it into the parkâ€™s theme.
